title: Executive Order 5144-Reserving Certain Described Lands Pending Resurvey, New Mexico
content: Under authority contained in the act of June 25, 1910 (36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (37 Stat. 497), and subject to the conditions, provisions and limitations of said acts, it is hereby ordered that the public lands in Ts. 11 and 12 N., Rs. 7 and 8 W., and T. 13 N., R. 7 W., N.M.P.M., New Mexico, be and the same are hereby withdrawn from settlement, location, sale, entry and all forms of appropriation, pending a resurvey of said townships under the act of March 3, 1909 (35 Stat. 845).
This order shall continue in full force and effect unless and until revoked by the President, or by an act of Congress.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5144-Reserving Certain Described Lands Pending Resurvey, New Mexico Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/360844
